item.title: Beyond Correctness: Confidence-Aware Reward Modeling for Enhancing Large Language Model Reasoning
item.description: arXiv:2511.07483v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Recent advancements in large language models (LLMs) have shifted the post-training paradigm from traditional instruction tuning and human preference alignment toward reinforcement learning (RL) focused on reasoning capabilities. item.title: TabPFN-2.5: Advancing the State of the Art in Tabular Foundation Models
item.description: arXiv:2511.08667v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The first tabular foundation model, TabPFN, and its successor TabPFNv2 have impacted tabular AI substantially, with dozens of methods building on it and hundreds of applications across different use cases.
